chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Trisha A Odya was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Dept.  Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.

Straigh Time.
Apply 72 days sentence credit.
TIME SERVED.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Cash bail applied to fine.  Balance of fine to be paid at $50 per month commencing 11-01-2015 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.

records.addlTxt: filed by State requesting restitution be ordered from dismissed and read-in case 15CF860 and advising the Court that defendant has agreed to restitution amount of $135.98.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Trisha A Odya in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Nicole M Masnica.    

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:  
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail
72 Days Credit.
Time Served.

16  Months D/L REVOCATION
16  Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35  (to be paid as a condition of probation - to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department);
FINE:  $1,179
DNA Surcharge:  $200
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 11/01/15 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate: 28  Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - Consecutive.
Bail to be refunded to the posting party.


OTHER:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 09-04-2015 11:30 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Trisha A Odya in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Nicole M Masnica.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 3.
Counts 1, 2, 4 & 5 are dismissed as read ins.

Matter put over for sentencing to comply with victim notification.

Bail is revoked pending sentencing.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 11:30 am.

DEFENDANT TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $500.00 CASH (TOTAL BAIL WILL BE $1500.00).
Conditions of bail remain as set as follows:
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.

Court reinstates bail.
